member.name: T:BrailleIO.Interface.AbstractViewBoxModelBase
member.summary: Abstract Implementation for an Element that has a fully functional view box ==> This element has also a full box model including margin, border and padding. Enables the direct usage of the reimplemented interface for defining a viewable area Enables the direct usage of the reimplemented interface for set and get positions Enables the direct usage of the reimplemented interface for making a oversize content pannable Enables the direct usage of the reimplemented interface for defining a border Enables the direct usage of the reimplemented interface for defining a padding Enables the direct usage of the reimplemented interface for defining a margin

member.name: T:BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel
member.summary: Interface for properties for handling a view box setting. This means there is a content that can be larger or smaller than the available display space.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel.ViewBox
member.summary: Gets or sets the view box. The viewBox defines the viewBox in size and offset to the content
member.value: The view box.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel.ContentBox
member.summary: Gets or sets the content box. The real view box. The space that can be used to show content. It can maximum be the Size of the ViewBox. Normally it is less. The Size of the ContentBox depends on the size of the ViewBox with respect of margin, border and padding.
member.value: The content box.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel.ContentWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the content. This is used to show the Scrollbars and to estimate the ratio between the content box and the hidden content.
member.value: The width of the whole content.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel.ContentHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the content. This is used to show the Scrollbars and to estimate the ratio between the content box and the hidden content.
member.value: The height of the whole content.

member.name: T:BrailleIO.Interface.IPannable
member.summary: Enables an implementing instance to indicate the possibilities for panning operation

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Interface.IPannable.GetXOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset in horizontal direction. Should normally be negative. Moves the position of the content by the offset. E.g. a negative offset should move the content to the left and the viewable region to the right.
member.returns: the horizontal offset

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Interface.IPannable.SetXOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the offset in horizontal direction. Should normally be negative. Moves the position of the content by the offset. E.g. a negative offset should move the content to the left and the viewable region to the right.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Interface.IPannable.GetYOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset in vertical direction. Should normally be negative. Moves the position of the content by the offset. E.g. a negative offset should move the content to up and the viewable region down.
member.returns: the vertical offset

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Interface.IPannable.SetYOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the offset in vertical direction. Should normally be negative. Moves the position of the content by the offset. E.g. a negative offset should move the content to up and the viewable region down.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Interface.IPannable.Move(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Move the content in both direction simultaneous. So the vertical and horizontal offset will been set at the same time.
member.param: The offsets in vertical and horizontal direction to move.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Interface.IPannable.ShowScrollbars
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show some scrollbars.
member.value: true if to show scrollbars; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Recalibrate the Touch detection Adapter with the specified threshold. //FIXME: BAD-HACK function to find bad detectors. Make this real working

member.summary: returns a matrix full of raised pins.
member.returns: a matrix full of raised pins in the dimension of the device.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is synchronize.
member.value: true if synchronize; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.AbstractBrailleIOAdapterBase.LockPins
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the pins should bee locked. This means no more synchronization should be possible. The last pin state stays as set until the lock is released and Synchronize(bool[,] matrix) is called.
member.value: true if [lock pins]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleInterpreter.IBraileInterpreter.GetDotsFromChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts a character (e.g. T) to a list of integer (e.g. 2,3,4,5,7) that indicates the positions of raised pins in a Braille cell.
member.returns: a List of integer indicating the raised dots as a position in a Braille cell. 1 4 2 5 3 6 7 8

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleInterpreter.IBraileInterpreter.GetDotsFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the dot pattern lists from string.
member.returns: A list of interpreted characters. Each child list of this list stands for one Braille cell. The Braille cell is given as a sublist, containing a list of raised pin positions inside a Braille cell.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleInterpreter.IBraileInterpreter.GetCharFromDots(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Gets the char from a dot pattern. Only one-cell patterns can be interpreted.
member.param: The dot pattern to interpret as a list of raised pin-positions inside a Braille cell . E.g. 2,3,4,5,7 will become a 'T'
member.returns: The correlated character to the requested dot pattern for one Braille cell.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.BrailleInterpreter.IBraileInterpreter.GetStringFormDots(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}})
member.summary: Gets the string form a list of dot patterns. Each sublist stands for one Braille cell.
member.param: The dot patterns to interpret. Each sublist is one Braille cell. The Sublist is a list of raised pin positions inside one Braille cell.
member.returns: A string of interpreted Braille dot patterns.

member.summary: Adds an adapter to the list of available adapters.
member.returns: if the Adapter could been added or not

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Interface.IBrailleIOAdapterManager.RemoveAdapter(BrailleIO.Interface.IBrailleIOAdapter)
member.summary: Removes an adapter form the list of available adapters.
member.returns: if the specific adapter could been removed or not

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Interface.IBrailleIOAdapterManager.GetAdapters
member.summary: Gets a list of all registered adapters.
member.returns: List of available adapters

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Interface.IBrailleIOAdapterManager.Synchronize(System.Boolean[0:,0:])
member.summary: Synchronizes the specified matrix with the Adapters. That means the given matrix will been send to the adapters. At least the active Adapter should display the matrix. Adapters that are able to set a "Synch" flag also should mirrow (display) the matrix.
member.param: The matrix to show on the output device.
member.returns: true if the matrix could been displayed successfully on the output device

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Interface.IBrailleIOAdapterManager.ActiveAdapter
member.summary: Gets or sets the active adapter. This is the main Adapter the output is sent to. At least one Adapter has to be active. Otherwise no rendering will happen.
member.value: The active adapter.

member.summary: The name of the changed property

member.name: T:BrailleIO.Interface.IBrailleIOContentRenderer
member.summary: Generic interface for a renderer for content of a has to implement. Then the instance can be added as a content renderer.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Interface.IBrailleIOContentRenderer.RenderMatrix(BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel,System.Object)
member.summary: Renders a content object into an boolean matrix; while true values indicating raised pins and false values indicating lowered pins
member.param: The frame to render in. This gives access to the space to render and other parameters. Normally this is a .
member.returns: A two dimensional boolean M x N matrix (bool[M,N]) where M is the count of rows (this is height) and N is the count of columns (which is the width). Positions in the Matrix are of type [i,j] while i is the index of the row (is the y position) and j is the index of the column (is the x position). In the matrix true values indicating raised pins and false values indicating lowered pins

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Interface.IBrailleIORendererInterfaces.RenderMatrix(BrailleIO.Interface.IViewBoxModel,System.Boolean[0:,0:])
member.summary: Renders a content object into an boolean matrix; while true values indicating raised pins and false values indicating lowered pins
member.param: The frame to render in. This gives access to the space to render and other parameters. Normally this is a .
member.returns: A two dimensional boolean M x N matrix (bool[M,N]) where M is the count of rows (this is height) and N is the count of columns (which is the width). Positions in the Matrix are of type [i,j] while i is the index of the row (is the y position) and j is the index of the column (is the x position). In the matrix true values indicating raised pins and false values indicating lowered pins

member.summary: Check if the element contains a requested point

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.IsCompletelyInArea(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if this elements bounding box is completely inside the given region.
member.param: Left border of the region to test (X).
Right border of the region to test (X + width).
Top border of the region to test (Y).
Bottom border of the region to test (Y + heigh).

member.param: Left border of the region to test (X).
Right border of the region to test (X + width).
Top border of the region to test (Y).
Bottom border of the region to test (Y + heigh).
member.returns: true if the element is at least partly inside the tested region, otherwise false

The vertical position of the point.

member.summary: Determine if this element has subparts registered.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.AddSubPart(BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement)
member.summary: Adds a new subpart at the end of the list.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.AddSubPartAfter(BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement,BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement)
member.summary: Adds a subpart after a specific one.
member.param: An element to add this after. If the element does not exist or is not inserted in the list, the element will be added as last element.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.AddSubPartBefore(BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement,BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement)
member.summary: Adds a subpart before a specific one.
member.param: An element to add this before. If the element does not exist or is not inserted in the list, the element will be added as first element.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.RemoveSubPart(BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement)
member.summary: Removes a subpart from the list of subparts.
member.returns: true if the list of suparts does not contain the element anymore.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.ContainsSubPart(BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement,System.Collections.Generic.LinkedListNode{BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement}@)
member.summary: Check if the SubPart List contains the requested Element
member.param: The found linked Element as output parameter or null
member.returns: true if the element is in the sub part list, otherwise false

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.updateBoundingBox
member.summary: Update the bounding box of this element depending on the bounding boxes of all subparts.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.updateBoundingBox(BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement)
member.summary: Update the current bounding box of this element with the given element's bounding box
member.param: the new element which bounding box should be included in this element's bounding box.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.HasParent
member.summary: Determines whether this instance has a parent.
member.returns: true if this instance has parent; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.GetParent
member.summary: Get the parent if one was set.
member.returns: The parent element as (a ) if one was set, otherwise null

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.SetParent(BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement)
member.summary: Set the parent element for this element. This does not register this element to the parent's subpart list - you have to do this manually! This function is called when this element is added to another subpart list.

member.name: M:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.DeleteParent
member.summary: Deletes the parent. Does not remove this element from the deleted parent's subpart list - you have to do this manually! This function is called when this element is removed from another subpart list.

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.X
member.summary: Horizontal start position of this element's bonding box

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.Y
member.summary: Vertical start position of this element's bonding box

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.Width
member.summary: Width of the element's bonding box

member.name: P:BrailleIO.Renderer.Structs.RenderElement.Height
